topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/533fa51c6368726e4a560200#post_533fa51c6368726e4a560200
Yeah.  It just scares the piss out of me.

I used to not get scared by it cause I would just go, "Oh just having another hallucination"; that was until I had one of these while in the presence of other people and several of them went, "Hey did you see that?"  "Yeah looks like someone was trying to sneak up on us" and described the same person.  So yeah you can understand why it now scares the shit out of me.

I'm okay, I'm calmed down; it's just super unnerving when it happens.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

There are things, seripus things that can make those allucinations and flashes, but there are others that are not so serious... I dont want to tell you, because you are calmed down. But that allutinations are called "simple visual hallucination"
topics.author: 31bee2686368722a0df23600

topics.body:
"@Gizoid101":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/533fa9876368720729f00000#post_533fa9876368720729f00000
I know what they are, know what was causing them(won't go into) and don't see almost any of them anymore except that one.  The thing that's terrifying is how can other people see that one particular one as well and it's only ever that single one?  That doesn't sound physically possible.  I'm not a physicist, but shared hallucinations does not sound possible.  That's some straight up scp crap.

I'm going to bed.


. . . "seripus" Wait, did you just call me a pussy?
